message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV

This paper investigates the robustness of NLP models against perturbed word forms, which is a common problem in natural language processing. The paper evaluates different models and basic units on different NLP tasks, such as morphological tagging and machine translation. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper uses neural networks, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also evaluates the impact of noise distributions, which could be related to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates the robustness of models against noisy input, which could be related to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
